Pre-Game Insights: Suryakumar Yadav starts a new chapter in his cricketing career as captain of the Indian team in T20Is.
Gautham Gambhir takes over as Head Coach of the Indian T20 team.
Sri Lanka will look to make amends for their dismal show in the recently concluded T20 World Cup, with Charith Asalanka leading the side’s revival.
Nuwan Thushara sustained a finger injury and is out of the series, bringing Dilshan Madushanka into the mix.
Hardik Pandya is back against an opposition he loves.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The series will take place from Saturday, July 27 to Tuesday, July 30, 2024, at Pallekele International Cricket Stadium, Pallekele.
India has a new captain and a new coach looking to chart their roadmap for the T20 World Cup 2026 to be held on home soil.
Head-to-head records in T20Is: India has won 19 matches, while Sri Lanka has won 9 matches out of 29 played.
